title: Tensors Exception Behavior
narrative:
This specification covers the behavior of the $Tsr class in
    exceptional scenarios which are contrary to its intended use.
    The purpose of this is to assert that the $Tsr class will provide
    useful feedback to a user to explain that a misuse of its API
    occurred so that the user can correct this misuse.
headers:
Tensors Exception Behavior


This specification covers the behavior of tensors in exceptional situations.

features.id: Trying to inject an empty tensor into another causes fitting exception.

blocks.text: A new tensor instance used for exception testing.
We try to inject an empty tensor whose size does of course not match...
The expected message is being thrown, which tells us that
code: assert exception.message.contains("Provided tensor is empty! Empty tensors cannot be injected.")

features.id: Passing null to various methods of the tensor API will throw exceptions.
Passing an invalid object into Tsr constructor causes descriptive exception.

blocks.text: A tensor is being instantiated with a nonsensical parameter.
An exception is being thrown which tells us about it.
code: "Could not create a random tensor for type 'class java.util.Scanner'!"

features.id: Passing an invalid key object into the "getAt" method causes a descriptive exception.

blocks.text: A new test tensor is being instantiated.
A nonsensical object is being passed to the tensor.
An exception is being thrown which tells us about it.
code: exception.message.contains("List of indices/ranges may not contain entries which are null!")

features.id: Out of dimension bound causes descriptive exception!

blocks.text: Some more complex slicing is being performed...
The slice range 1..3 causes and exception!
code: "Cannot create slice because ranges are out of the bounds of the targeted tensor.\n" +
"which is larger than the target shape '3' at the same index!"

blocks.text: The logger logs the exception message!
code: "Cannot create slice because ranges are out of the bounds of the targeted tensor.\n" +
"which is larger than the target shape '3' at the same index!")

features.id: Building a tensor with 0 shape arguments throws an exception.
Casting a tensor as something unusual will cuas an exception to be thrown.

blocks.text: We have a regular tensor of 2 bytes!
We try to convert the tensor to an instance of type "Random"...
This will obviously least to an exception being thrown.

features.id: Building a tensor with "null" as shape argument throws an exception.
